soilquality: Soil Quality Index Calculation with PCA and AHP

Source: R/soilquality-package.R
soilquality-package.Rd

Provides tools for calculating Soil Quality Index (SQI) using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for Minimum Data Set (MDS) selection and Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) for expert-based weighting. The package transforms soil property data into standardized quality metrics with comprehensive visualization and interactive tools.

The soilquality package provides a comprehensive toolkit for calculating Soil Quality Index (SQI) using scientifically validated methods. It combines Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for selecting a Minimum Data Set (MDS) of indicators with the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) for expert-based weighting.

Main Features

  • Data Handling: Import and standardize soil property data

  • MDS Selection: Use PCA to identify key soil indicators

  • Expert Weighting: Apply AHP for indicator importance

  • Flexible Scoring: Multiple scoring functions for different property types

  • Visualization: Comprehensive plotting functions for results

  • Interactive Tools: Shiny application for non-programmers

Key Functions

Main Workflow Functions:

  • compute_sqi: Calculate SQI from CSV files

  • compute_sqi_df: Calculate SQI from data frames

  • compute_sqi_properties: Calculate SQI with property selection

Data Handling:

  • read_soil_csv: Read soil data from CSV files

  • standardize_numeric: Standardize numeric columns

PCA and MDS Selection:

  • pca_select_mds: Perform PCA and select minimum data set

AHP Weighting:

  • create_ahp_matrix: Interactive AHP matrix creation

  • ahp_weights: Calculate weights from pairwise comparisons

Scoring Functions:

  • higher_better: Constructor for properties where higher is better

  • lower_better: Constructor for properties where lower is better

  • optimum_range: Constructor for properties with optimal ranges

  • threshold_scoring: Constructor for custom threshold-based scoring

  • standard_scoring_rules: Get standard scoring rules for common properties

Property Sets:

  • soil_property_sets: Pre-defined collections of soil properties

Visualization:

  • plot.sqi_result: Plot SQI results (S3 method)

  • plot_sqi_report: Generate comprehensive multi-panel report

Interactive Tools:

  • run_sqi_app: Launch interactive Shiny application

Getting Started

The typical workflow for calculating SQI involves:

1. Load your data: Use read_soil_csv() or provide a data frame 2. Select properties: Choose relevant soil properties for analysis 3. Define scoring rules: Specify how each property should be scored 4. Calculate SQI: Use compute_sqi_properties() or related functions 5. Visualize results: Use plot() or plot_sqi_report()

Example Workflow


# Load example data
data(soil_ucayali)

# Calculate SQI with standard properties
result <- compute_sqi_properties(
  data = soil_ucayali,
  properties = c("pH", "OM", "N", "P", "K", "CEC"),
  id_column = "SampleID"
)

# View results
print(result)

# Create visualizations
plot(result, type = "distribution")
plot(result, type = "weights")

# Generate comprehensive report
plot_sqi_report(result)

Custom Scoring Rules

You can define custom scoring rules for each property:


# Define scoring rules
rules <- list(
  pH = optimum_range(optimal = 6.5, tolerance = 1),
  OM = higher_better(),
  BD = lower_better(),
  P = higher_better()
)

# Calculate SQI with custom rules
result <- compute_sqi_properties(
  data = soil_ucayali,
  properties = names(rules),
  scoring_rules = rules,
  id_column = "SampleID"
)

Interactive Mode

For users who prefer a graphical interface:


# Launch Shiny application
run_sqi_app()

Package Options

The package uses the following options:

  • None currently defined

References

  • Andrews, S. S., Karlen, D. L., & Cambardella, C. A. (2004). The soil management assessment framework: A quantitative soil quality evaluation method. Soil Science Society of America Journal, 68(6), 1945-1962.

  • Saaty, T. L. (1980). The Analytic Hierarchy Process. McGraw-Hill, New York.
